Name: treatment of leachate, SLF, scrap tin sheet, wastewater treatment | leachate, SLF, scrap tin sheet | EN15804GD, U
Category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/37:Sewerage/370:Sewerage/3700:Sewerage
Description: This is an inventory for the disposal of a selected wastewater in Ecuador. The reference unit is 1 m3 wastewater input. This activity represents the treatment of a specific wastewater in a WWT plant (while direct emissions and sewering are heeded in the upstream market dataset for this wastewater). The size of the treatment plant infrastructure is for a national average territory situation. The assumed size of the WWTP treats 102 Mio m3 per year. The mixture of WWTP with one, two, or three stages is 13.4%-68.2%-18.4%. The actual, waste-specific oxygen requirement in the biological stages is 0.0007283kg O. The generated waste-specific raw sludge mass is treated with anaerobic digestion. The digestion process produces 0.531 litres of biogas with an energy content of 0.0097MJ. 0% of the biogas is utilized for energy. The remainder is flared. The gross electric efficiency is 0%. The gross thermal efficiency is 0%.
